glossdef.para: Backus-Naur Form, a “metasyntax notation for context-free grammars”.
Extended Backus-Naur Form, an extension of basic Backus-Naur form grammars, often to make authoring easier.

The Earley parser is a chart parser that uses dynamic programming. It is an early (no pun intended; the first?citation needed) example of a parser that can parse all context-free languages, not just subsets in which ambiguity can be resolved with some constant lookahead.
A fully general LL parser. An LL parser is one that operates from left-to-right using the leftmost derivation. Informally, GLL is an LL parser that is capable of resolving ambiguous parsers.
The Java virtual machine, the platform on which languages like Java, Scala, Groovy, Kotlin, and Clojure operate.
The X-stack is an informal way of referring to the collection of XML-related technologies used to build applications: XML, XSLT, XQuery, XProc, XForms, RESTXQ, etc.

bibliography.title: Bibliography
bibliography.para: These are some important and/or interesting references. No claim is made that this is an exhaustive list.
bibliography.bibliomixed: Brabrand, Claus, Robert Giegerich, and Anders Möller. “Analyzing Ambiguity of Context-Free Grammars.” Science of Computer Programming, volume 75, number 3. Elsevier. (2010). https://cs.au.dk/~amoeller/papers/ambiguity/. doi:10.1016/j.scico.2009.11.002.
Grune, Dick, et. al. Modern Compiler Design, second edition. Springer Publishing Company. ISBN: 978-1-4939-4472-9. 01 May 2016.
Pemberton, Steven. “Invisible XML Specification.” Published by the Invisible Markup Community Group on the web at https://invisiblexml.org/1.0/.
Schwarz, Keith. Advanced Parsing Techniques. CS143: Compilers. Stanford University.
Scott, Elizabeth. SPPF-Style Parsing From Earley Recognisers. Electronic Notes in Theoretical Computer Science. 203, 2, p. 53-67, Apr 2008.
Scott, Elizabeth and Adrian Johnstone. GLL Parsing. Electronic Notes in Theoretical Computer Science. 253, p. 177-189, 2010.
Scott, Elizabeth, Adrian Johnston, and L. Thomas van Binsbergen. Derivation representation using binary subtree sets. Science of Computer Programming. 175, p. 63-84 22 p. 15 Apr 2019.
